definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
lit. to wield the broadsword in the presence of Lord Guan (idiom)/fig. to make a fool of oneself by showing off in front of an expert
pinyin: Guan1 gong1 mian4 qian2 shua3 da4 dao1

sentences.english: The little child stammers in the presence of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 那小阿在陌生人面前说话就结巴。

sentences.english: Melva kisses another guy in front of her boyfriend justifying it to herself as an eye for an eye.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔瓦在男友面前亲吻另一个男孩，自以为报复。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he perceived a pale girl standing before him.
sentences.chinese: 他看见一个面色蜡黄的姑娘站在他面前。

sentences.english: This hand torch, Helios flew before, please him.
sentences.chinese: 这才手执火把，飞到赫利俄斯面前，请他指点迷津。

sentences.english: You're looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.
sentences.chinese: 在你面前是一位今晚很可能被流浪猫放鸽子的男士。

sentences.english: To find out, hold a pencil up in front of you and block out the flaps.
sentences.chinese: 要寻找答案，拿根铅笔在面前屏蔽掉这些旗。

sentences.english: The road ahead for Libya and its people will be difficult and full of challenges.
sentences.chinese: 利比亚面前的路将充满坎坷和挑战。

sentences.english: Theo had a game based on individual action. Wilshere as well is a guy who goes at you and dribbles.
sentences.chinese: 威尔希尔一样是一个带球到你面前过掉你的球风。

sentences.english: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
sentences.chinese: 你是废弃敬畏的意，在神面前阻止敬虔的心。

sentences.english: It is easier to square the circle than to get round a mathematician.
sentences.chinese: 从数学家面前混过去比“化圆为方”还难。

sentences.english: Yesterday was the last time for me to play the Jpananese drams before the spectators.
sentences.chinese: 在众人面前的演奏昨天也迎来了其暂时的帷幕。

sentences.english: Thanks to my shake-proof shoes, I can still stand and sit here.
sentences.chinese: 多亏了我的防震鞋，我还能站在你面前做着在这里。

sentences.english: And thus I comytt you to god.
Hold them steadily before Him in faith and prayer.
sentences.chinese: 用信心和祷告带到他面前来。

sentences.english: But she kept calm amid all these excitements.
sentences.chinese: 但她在所有激动面前保持镇静。

sentences.english: Two and a half hours later, she emerges, dazed and emotional.
sentences.chinese: 两个半小时后，她昏昏沉沉地出现在我面前。

definition: in front of/in the presence of
in hand/(a situation is) in sb's hands
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
